TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 38
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James F Perry, 05-10-1828

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to James F. Perry, May 10, 1828. Introducing John Austin, who \Ksits St Louis.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 38

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, May 10, 1828. Introducing John Austin, who \Ksits St Louis. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-10-1828">May 10. 1828*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My Dear *person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*This will be handed to you by *person_mentioned*Mr. John Austin*/person_mentioned* a relative of ours, he has business in *location_mentioned*St Louis */location_mentioned*and has promised to call at the *location_mentioned*mines*/location_mentioned* and see you—his stay probably will be very short, tho. long enough to give him time to answer your enquiries relative to this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*has been with me several years in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, he is a truly worthy man and you must make him as comfortable as you can while with you—*/p*
*p*I wrote you a short time ago and have nothing particular to say since—*person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*will write you from *location_mentioned*Orleans*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
